videoSnippet.title: When Absolutely Everything Goes Wrong || Firouzja vs Nakamura || MC Invitational (2020)
videoSnippet.description:
Support fishnet here https://lichess.org/get-fishnet

Follow me on Instagram for extra content and notifications https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Alireza Firouzja vs Hikaru Nakamura
Magnus Carlsen Invitational GAME 3, 22.4.2020
Queen's Gambit Declined, classical variation (5.Bf4) (D37)

1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 d5 4. Nc3 Be7 5. Bf4 O-O 6. e3 Nbd7 7. c5 c6 8. h3 b6 9. b4 a5 10. a3 h6 11. Bd3 Ba6 12. O-O Qc8 13. Re1 Bxd3 14. Qxd3 Qb7 15. Reb1 axb4 16. axb4 Rfc8 17. Nd2 Rxa1 18. Rxa1 Ra8 19. Qb1 Bd8 20. Rxa8 Qxa8 21. Qa2 Qb7 22. Qa4 b5 23. Qa3 Ne8 24. e4 dxe4 25. Ncxe4 Ndf6 26. Nd6 Nxd6 27. cxd6 Nd5 28. Bg3 Bb6 29. Nb3 f6 30. Nc5 Bxc5 31. dxc5 e5 32. f3 Kf7 33. Be1 Nf4 34. Qa2+ Ne6 35. Bd2 Qd7 36. h4 h5 37. Be3 Kg8 38. Qc2 Nf8 39. Qe4 Qc8 40. g4 hxg4 41. fxg4 Qa6 42. g5 Kf7 43. gxf6 gxf6 44. Bf2 Qb7 45. h5 Qd7 46. Kh2 Kg7 47. Be3 Qc8 48. h6+ Kh8 49. Kg3 Qd7 50. Kg2 Qc8 51. Kh2 Qd7 52. Kg3 Qc8 53. Qg4 Qb7 54. Qf5 Qf7 55. Bf2 Nd7 56. Qe4 f5 57. Qh4 Nf6 58. Kh3 Kh7 59. Bg3 f4 60. Bf2 Qe6+ 61. Kg2 Qf5 62. Kh2 Kg6 63. Qh3 Qxh3+ 64. Kxh3 Kxh6 65. Bh4 Nd7 66. Kg4 Kg6 67. Bg5 f3 68. Bh4 Kf7 69. Kxf3 Ke6 70. Ke4 Nb8 71. Be7 Na6 72. Bg5 Nxb4 73. Be3 Nd5 74. Bd2 Nf6+ 75. Kd3 Kd5 76. Be3 Ke6 77. Bd2 Nd7 78. Be3 Kd5 79. Bf2 b4 80. Bg1 e4+ 81. Kc2 Kc4 82. Kb2 Ne5 83. Bf2 Nd7 84. Bg1 b3 85. Bf2 Kd3 86. Kxb3 e3 87. Be1 Nxc5+ 88. Kb4 Nd7 89. Ka5 Kc4 90. Bg3 Kb3 91. Ka6 c5 92. Kb5 c4 93. Kc6 Nf8

And also:

Hikaru Nakamura vs Alireza Firouzja
Magnus Carlsen Invitational GAME , 22.4.2020
Scandinavian (centre counter) defence (B01

1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5 4. b4 Qxb4 5. Rb1 Qd6 6. d4 Qd8 7. Bc4 Nf6 8. Nf3 e6 9. O-O Be7 10. Ne5 O-O 11. Re1 c5 12. d5 exd5 13. Nxd5 Be6 14. Nxf7

World Champion Magnus Carlsen takes on world blitz no. 1 Hikaru Nakamura today in a 4-game rapid match as the $250,000 Magnus Carlsen Invitational begins. Usually that pairing would eclipse any other match, but 16-year-old Alireza Firouzja taking on world no. 3 Ding Liren is almost as mouth-watering. Can Alireza continue in the form that saw him beat Magnus in the Banter Blitz Cup final? All the games will be streamed live on chess24 with commentary in 9 languages as a new age of online chess begins.

https://chess24.com/en/read/news/the-magnus-carlsen-invitational-starts-today
